00041 
00042 #ifndef PIZ_GROWING_ARRAY_H
00043 #define PIZ_GROWING_ARRAY_H
00044 
00045 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00046 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00047 
00048 #include "pizTypes.h"
00049 
00050 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00051 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00052 
00053 /**
00054  * \ingroup growingArray
00055  */
00056  
00057 typedef struct _PIZGrowingArray {
00058     long size;                                  /* Current size of the array. */
00059     long index;                                 /* Number of values in the array. */
00060     long *values;                               /* Pointer to the array. */
00061     } PIZGrowingArray;
00062 
00063 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00064 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00065 
00066 PIZ_START_C_LINKAGE
00067 
00068 /**
00069  * \brief   Create the dynamic array.
00070  * \param   size The size of memory allocated initially to the array.
00071  * \details In case of failure the pointer is NULL.
00072  * \return  A pointer to the new dynamic array.
00073  * \remark  The following shows how to create a dynamic array.  
00074  * \code
00075  * PIZGrowingArray *array = NULL;
00076  *
00077  * array = pizGrowingArrayNew (16);  
00078  * array = pizGrowingArrayNew (0);  // default value is 4.
00079  *
00080  * \endcode 
00081  * \ingroup growingArray
00082  */
00083 PIZGrowingArray *pizGrowingArrayNew (long size);
00084 
00085 /**
00086  * \brief   Free the dynamic array.
00087  * \details It is safe to pass NULL pointer.
00088  * \param   x A Pointer.
00089  * \ingroup growingArray
00090  */
00091 void pizGrowingArrayFree (PIZGrowingArray *x);
00092 
00093 /**
00094  * \brief   Clear the dynamic array.
00095  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00096  * \ingroup growingArray
00097  */
00098 void pizGrowingArrayClear (PIZGrowingArray *x);
00099 
00100 /**
00101  * \brief   Append a value to the array.
00102  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00103  * \param   value The value to append.
00104  * \return  An error code.
00105  * \remark  The memory is doubled in case of exceeding.
00106  * \ingroup growingArray
00107  */
00108 PIZError pizGrowingArrayAppend (PIZGrowingArray *x, long value);
00109 
00110 /**
00111  * \brief   Set the value at a specified index.
00112  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00113  * \param   index The index (zero-based).
00114  * \param   value The value.
00115  * \warning For efficiency the index is NOT checked ; so crash may occured with invalid indexing.
00116  * \ingroup growingArray
00117  */
00118 void pizGrowingArraySetValueAtIndex (PIZGrowingArray *x, long index, long value);
00119 
00120 /**
00121  * \brief   Get the number of values in the array.
00122  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00123  * \return  The number of values.
00124  * \ingroup growingArray
00125  */
00126 long pizGrowingArrayCount (const PIZGrowingArray *x);
00127 
00128 /**
00129  * \brief   Get the value at a specified index.
00130  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00131  * \param   index The index (zero-based).
00132  * \return  The value.
00133  * \warning For efficiency the index is NOT checked ; so crash may occured with invalid indexing.
00134  * \ingroup growingArray
00135  */
00136 long pizGrowingArrayValueAtIndex (const PIZGrowingArray *x, long index);
00137 
00138 /**
00139  * \brief   Retrieve the pointer to internal array.
00140  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00141  * \return  The pointer.
00142  * \warning This function is provided for efficiency but it should be used carefully.
00143  * \ingroup growingArray
00144  */
00145 long *pizGrowingArrayPtr (const PIZGrowingArray *x); 
00146 
00147 /**
00148  * \brief   Remove the value at a specified index.
00149  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00150  * \param   index The index.
00151  * \ingroup growingArray
00152  */
00153 void pizGrowingArrayRemoveIndex (PIZGrowingArray *x, long index);
00154 
00155 /**
00156  * \brief   Remove the last value.
00157  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00158  * \ingroup growingArray
00159  */
00160 PIZError pizGrowingArrayRemoveLastValue (PIZGrowingArray *x);
00161 
00162 /**
00163  * \brief   Given a value, get the index of the first equal value found.
00164  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00165  * \param   value The value to find.
00166  * \return  The index if found, otherwise -1.
00167  * \ingroup growingArray
00168  */
00169 long pizGrowingArrayFirstIndexOfValue (const PIZGrowingArray *x, long value);
00170 
00171 /**
00172  * \brief   Test if the array countains the provided value.
00173  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00174  * \param   value The value to find.
00175  * \return  True if found, otherwise false.
00176  * \ingroup growingArray
00177  */
00178 bool pizGrowingArrayContainsValue (const PIZGrowingArray *x, long value);
00179 
00180 /**
00181  * \brief   Copy a dynamic array.
00182  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00183  * \param   toCopy A valid pointer to the dynamic array to be copied.
00184  * \return  An error code.
00185  * \remark  The new memory size reallocated is the memory size of the copied array in case of exceeding.
00186  * \ingroup growingArray
00187  */
00188 PIZError pizGrowingArrayCopy (PIZGrowingArray *x, const PIZGrowingArray *toCopy);
00189 
00190 /**
00191  * \brief   Append a dynamic array.
00192  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00193  * \param   toAppend A valid pointer to the dynamic array to be appended.
00194  * \return  An error code.
00195  * \remark  The new memory size reallocated is the sum of both memory sizes in case of exceeding.
00196  * \ingroup growingArray
00197  */
00198 PIZError pizGrowingArrayAppendArray (PIZGrowingArray *x, const PIZGrowingArray *toAppend);
00199 
00200 /**
00201  * \brief   Append a \c long array.
00202  * \param   x A valid pointer.
00203  * \param   argc The number of values to append.
00204  * \param   argv The pointer to the values to append.
00205  * \remark  The new memory size is set according to a geometric progression of ratio 2.
00206  * \ingroup growingArray
00207  */
00208 PIZError pizGrowingArrayAppendPtr (PIZGrowingArray *x, long argc, long *argv);
00209 
00210 PIZ_END_C_LINKAGE
00211 
00212 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00213 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00214 
00215 #ifdef PIZ_EXTERN_INLINE
00216 
00217 PIZ_EXTERN void pizGrowingArrayClear (PIZGrowingArray *x)
00218 {
00219     x->index = 0;
00220 }
00221 
00222 PIZ_EXTERN void pizGrowingArraySetValueAtIndex (PIZGrowingArray *x, long index, long value)
00223 {
00224     x->values[index] = value;
00225 }
00226 
00227 PIZ_EXTERN long pizGrowingArrayCount (const PIZGrowingArray *x)
00228 {
00229     return (x->index);
00230 }
00231 
00232 PIZ_EXTERN long pizGrowingArrayValueAtIndex (const PIZGrowingArray *x, long index)
00233 {   
00234     return (x->values[index]);
00235 }
00236 
00237 PIZ_EXTERN long *pizGrowingArrayPtr (const PIZGrowingArray *x)
00238 {
00239     return (x->values);
00240 }
00241 
00242 #endif // PIZ_EXTERN_INLINE
00243 
00244 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00245 // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00246 #endif // PIZ_GROWING_ARRAY_H
